description:
What are some of the best questions/answers asked/given by kids?孩子们都问过哪些萌萌的问题跟答案？

获得3.8k好评的回答：@Sowmya Muthusamy

Once my six year old son asked me: mom can you tell me why a human baby takes so long to walk on its own, while the young ones of animals walk immediately after birth?有一次，我6岁的儿子问我：妈妈，你能告诉我为什么人类的小宝宝要那么久才学会走路，但是那些动物宝宝生下来就会走路了呢？

I was still thinking and trying to give him the most appropriate answer, he came back with his simple answer almost immediately after he questioned: because humans have two legs, so we have to learn balancing like riding a bicycle, but animals have four legs, hence they stand firmly within minutes after birth.我一直在想啊想，试图给他个合适的答案，他却是问了之后马上告诉我了一个再简单不过的回答：因为人类只有两条腿，所以我们要像学骑自行车一样平衡自己，但是动物有四条腿，这样他们生来就能平稳站立了。

获得2.5k好评的回答：@Peter Flom

My son, aged 8 asked
"How are dolphins like tomatoes?"
I didn't know. I have asked many people this question. None have gotten it. His answer
A dolphin is a mammal that lots of people think is a fish and a tomato is a fruit that a lot of people think is a vegetable.
我8岁的儿子问，
“海豚如何像西红柿？”
我不知道哎。我有问过很多人这个问题。没人知道答案。他回答到：
“海豚是哺乳动物，但是很多人以为它是鱼类；而西红柿是水果，很多人以为是蔬菜。”

This poem, by a 4th grader in New York City, asks a question:这首诗，是纽约城4年级的小盆友写的，ta问：

The races of the world
Are like the colors of a rainbow.
Would a rainbow of one color
Be beautiful?
全世界的种族
就像彩虹的颜色
如果彩虹只有一种颜色
还会这么美吗？

获得17.9k好评的回答：@Arjunraj Natarajan

Valuable lesson learnt from a five year old.从我五岁孩子身上学到的珍贵的一课：

Little girl: Why do we call the man who picks up garbage bag from our home everyday as kachrawala(garbage man)?
Mother: Because he collects kachra(garbage)!
Little girl: How come he is kachrawala(garbage man). He collects garbage and keeps the environment clean. He should be called safaiwala(cleanliness man) and it is we who spread more garbage so we should be  called kachrawala (garbage man).
小女孩：每天从我们家收垃圾的人，我们为什么要叫他“垃圾工”？
母亲：因为他收垃圾呀！
小女孩：怎么叫他垃圾工呢。他清除垃圾，让环境变整洁了。他应该被叫作“清洁工”呀，我们这些丢垃圾的人才应该被叫“垃圾工”呢！

获得1.2k好评的回答：@Leslie Jeffries

I had a friend's daughter over to our house to play one day, she was about 4 or 5. She had lived in apartments her whole life and we had a fire going in our fireplace. She looked at me and said "Why are you cooking wood?"我有个朋友的孩子被送来我们家玩儿一天，她大约四五岁。她一直都住在她们家公寓里。我们在我们的壁炉里烧火。他看看我然后说：“为什么你们在煮木头？”

获得8k好评的回答：@Tania Amarlapudi

Story of a 6-year-old kid.
Teacher: How old is your father?
Kid: He is 6 years.
Teacher: What? How is this possible?
Kid: He became father only when I was born.
一个六岁孩子的故事
老师问：“你父亲几岁啦？”
孩子回答：“他6岁了。”
老师:“什么？怎么可能？”
孩子：“我出生的时候他才开始做爸爸的。”

获得9.3k好评的回答：@Ed Benevides

My daughter was about 3.  We were studying birds and I explained that birds lay eggs.  Emma said, "Not all birds lay eggs."  I thought about that for a minute then I asked her, "Which birds don't lay eggs?"  and she said, "The boy birds don't."我女儿大约五岁的时候。我们正在学习鸟的知识，我告诉她鸟会产蛋。艾玛说，“不是所有的鸟都产蛋的。”我想了一分钟之后问她，“那只鸟不会产蛋呢？”然后她说，“公鸟不会。”

获得4.1k好评的回答：@Dave Hagler

My 7 year old had answers for what B.C. and A.D. mean: "Before Computers" and "After Dinosaurs".我7岁（孩子）回答缩写BC和AD的意义：“在电脑（时代）之前”和“恐龙灭绝之后”。

（翻译：山风的风）
